workflow.name: Sync Amazon Luna Prime games to Google Sheets with automatic updates
workflow.description:
## Amazon Luna Prime Games Catalog Tracker (Auto-Sync to Google Sheets)**

Automatically fetch, organize, and maintain an updated catalog of **Amazon Luna ‚Äì Included with Prime** games.This workflow regularly queries Amazon‚Äôs official Luna endpoint, extracts complete metadata, and syncs everything into Google Sheets without duplicates.

Ideal for:

* tracking monthly **Prime Luna rotations**
  
* keeping a personal archive of games
  
* monitoring **new games appearing on Amazon Games / Prime Gaming**, so you can instantly play titles you‚Äôre interested in
  
* building dashboards or gaming databases
  
* powering notification systems (Discord, Telegram, email, etc.)
  

* * *

### **Overview**

Amazon Luna‚Äôs ‚ÄúIncluded with Prime‚Äù lineup changes frequently, with new games added and old ones removed.Instead of checking manually, this n8n template fully automates the process:

* Fetches the latest list from Amazon‚Äôs backend
  
* Extracts detailed metadata from the response
  
* Syncs the data into Google Sheets
  
* Avoids duplicates by updating existing rows
  
* Supports all major Amazon regions
  

Once configured, it runs automatically‚Äîkeeping your game catalog correct, clean, and always up to date.

* * *

#### üõ†Ô∏è **How the workflow works**

**1. Scheduled Trigger**

Starts the workflow on a set schedule (default: every 5 days at 3:00 PM).You can change both frequency and time freely.

**2. HTTP Request to Amazon Luna**

Calls Amazon Luna‚Äôs regional endpoint and retrieves the full **‚ÄúIncluded with Prime‚Äù** catalog.

**3. JavaScript Code Node ‚Äì Data Extraction**

Parses the JSON response and extracts structured fields:

* Title
  
* Genres
  
* Release Year
  
* ASIN
  
* Image URLs
  
* Additional metadata
  

The result is a clean, ready-to-use dataset.

**4. Google Sheets ‚Äì Insert or Update Rows**

Each game is written into the selected Google Sheet:

* Existing games get updated
  
* New games are appended
  

The **Title** acts as the unique identifier to prevent duplicates.

* * *

##¬†‚öôÔ∏è **Configuration Parameters**

| Parameter | Description | Recommended values |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **x-amz-locale** | Language + region | `it_IT` üáÆüáπ ¬∑ `en_US` üá∫üá∏ ¬∑ `de_DE` üá©üá™ ¬∑ `fr_FR` üá´üá∑ ¬∑ `es_ES` üá™üá∏ ¬∑ `en_GB` üá¨üáß ¬∑ `ja_JP` üáØüáµ ¬∑ `en_CA` üá®üá¶ |
| **x-amz-marketplace-id** | Marketplace backend ID | `APJ6JRA9NG5V4` üáÆüáπ ¬∑ `ATVPDKIKX0DER` üá∫üá∏ ¬∑ `A1PA6795UKMFR9` üá©üá™ ¬∑ `A13V1IB3VIYZZH` üá´üá∑ ¬∑ `A1RKKUPIHCS9HS` üá™üá∏ ¬∑ `A1F83G8C2ARO7P` üá¨üáß ¬∑ `A1VC38T7YXB528` üáØüáµ ¬∑ `A2EUQ1WTGCTBG2` üá®üá¶ |
| **Accept-Language** | Response language | Example: `it-IT,it;q=0.9,en;q=0.8` |
| **User-Agent** | Browser-like request | Default or updated UA |
| **Trigger interval** | Refresh frequency | Every 5 days at 3:00 PM (modifiable) |
| **Google Sheet** | Storage output | Select your file + sheet |

You can adapt these headers to fetch data from any supported country.

* * *

üí° **Tips & Customization**

#### üåç Regional catalogs

Duplicate the HTTP Request + Code + Sheet block to track multiple countries (US, DE, JP, UK‚Ä¶).

#### üßπ No duplicates

The workflow updates rows intelligently, ensuring a clean catalog even after many runs.

#### üóÇÔ∏è Move data anywhere

Send the output to:

* Airtable
  
* Databases (MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB‚Ä¶)
  
* Notion
  
* CSV
  
* REST APIs
  
* BI dashboards
  

#### üîî Add notifications (Discord, Telegram, Email, etc.)

You can pair this template with a notification workflow.When used with **Discord**, the notification message can include:

* game title
  
* description or metadata
  
* **the game‚Äôs image**, automatically downloaded and attached
  

This makes notifications visually informative and perfect for tracking new Prime titles.

* * *

### üîí **Important Notes**

* All retrieved data belongs to **Amazon**.
  
* The workflow is intended for **personal, testing, or educational use only**.
  
* Do not republish or redistribute collected data without permission.

assignments.name: User-Agent
assignments.value: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/0.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

parameters.content:
### Section 3 ‚Äì New game notifications

The ‚ÄúisNew‚Äù and ‚ÄúIf1‚Äù nodes keep only new titles. For each new game, the image is fetched, items are processed in small batches and a Wait node adds a short pause to avoid rate limits. Finally a message is sent to your notification channel.

#### Choose a notification provider

By default this template uses a Discord node to post messages in a channel. Select your Discord credentials and channel ID, or replace this node with another service (Telegram, Slack, email, webhooks, etc.) while keeping the rest of the flow unchanged.

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.content:
### Section 2 ‚Äì Update Google Sheet

The ‚ÄúAppend or update row in sheet‚Äù node writes the parsed games to your Google Sheet. Rows are matched by title so existing entries are updated and only new games are appended with their ASIN, genres and image URLs.

### Section 1 ‚Äì Amazon request parameters

The **Edit Fields** node defines all required headers for the Amazon Luna request.  
Here you should set:

- `x-amz-locale` (language/region)
- `x-amz-marketplace-id` (marketplace for your region)
- `Accept-Language`
- `User-Agent`
- platform and device type

The **HTTP Request** node uses these values to call the Luna endpoint and retrieve the list of ‚ÄúIncluded with Prime‚Äù games.

## Amazon Luna ‚Äì Included with Prime

This workflow periodically fetches the list of ‚ÄúIncluded with Prime‚Äù games from Amazon Luna, parses the response, and keeps a Google Sheet in sync without duplicates.  

New titles are flagged and can be sent as notifications to a channel of your choice (for example Discord, Telegram, Slack, or email).  

Before activating the workflow, configure the Amazon request headers, region/marketplace, and Google Sheets document.

#### Full Guide: https://paoloronco.it/amazon-luna-fetch-included-with-prime-games/

### Video
[![Watch the video](https://img.youtube.com/vi/PS6qdCbc5fU/maxresdefault.jpg)](https://youtu.be/PS6qdCbc5fU)


### Important notes

- The data returned by this workflow comes from Amazon Luna and remains the property of Amazon.  
Use it only for personal or testing purposes.  

- Do not republish, redistribute, or share the results publicly without permission.  
Headers, endpoint and response format may change over time, so if the workflow stops working, double-check the values used in the **Edit Fields** and **HTTP Request** nodes.

main.node: Append or update row in sheet

user.name: Paolo Ronco
user.bio:
Cybersecurity Analyst passionate about automation, cloud, and infrastructure.
Since discovering n8n, I automate everything I can: workflows, processes, integrations, and repetitive tasks.
I love building, optimizing, and making systems more secure, faster, and scalable.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
